item.value: John Logie Baird was the inventor of the world's first working television system in Hastings, England in 1923.
The world's population grows by over 100 million each year.
The creator of the first working light bulb was Joseph Wilson Swan.
Gravity keeps Earth and the other planets in our solar system in orbit around the Sun. It also keeps the Moon in orbit around Earth.
The shortest woman was Pauline Muster. She was 58 cm ( 23 in ) tall.
The average distance from the earth to the Sun is 150 million kilometers (93 million miles). If you could travel from Earth to the Sun in a plane it would take you 17 years
Roughly 70 percent of an adult's body is made up of water.
Electric eels can stun both predators and prey with electric shocks of around 500 volts.
Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876.
The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. Known as the Great Chilean Earthquake, the quake measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.
The Amazon is the second longest river. It is 6.400 km ( 4,000 miles ) long. It flows into the Atlantic ocean.
The moon orbits the Earth every 27.32 days
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in Japan and died a week before her 115th birthday.
The Sun is one of about 200 billion stars in the Milky Way galaxy. The most current estimates guess that there are 100 to 200 billion galaxies in the Universe
The city with the largest population is Shanghai in China. It has almost 14 million inhabitants.
On April 30, 1789, George Washington became the first President of the United States.
New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It is about 38 million kilometers away. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
The shortfin Mako shark is the fastest fish.
The Sputnik 1, launched on October 4, 1957 by Russia, was the first human-made object to orbit the Earth.
